EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



ENVIRONMENTAL MISSION STATEMENT

At NovaStar LP, we are committed to a role of environmental leadership and compliance in all facets of our manufacturing processes.  We regard environmental compliance as a pre-requisite to commercial success, and strive to ensure the safety of our community and employees by assuring the safe operation of our processes.  We at NovaStar LP attempt to instill a proactive culture toward regulatory compliance which prompts our employees to strive for excellence in the areas of environmental, health, and safety compliance.  

NovaStar LP focuses on the use of sound scientific and engineering principals to manage risks that may arise from our regulated processes.  Our facility is designed and operated to mitigate the potential for any adverse environmental impact.  

Through the implementation of this Risk Management Plan, NovaStar LP endeavors to comply fully with those regulations set forth in the Accidental Release Prevention Requirements: Risk Management Program Title 40 CFR PART 68.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICY

NovaStar LP has prepared and maintains a SPILL PREVENTION, CONTROL, AND COUNTERMEASURE PLAN (SPCC PLAN) which outlines our accidental release prevention philosophy and policy.  The SPCC plan identifies the potential for an accidental release by identifying the Aboveground Storage Tanks, their contents, and the maximum quantity of chemical that could potentially be released in a catastrophic event.  Engineering controls are also identified in the SPCC plan to document measures taken to mitigate potential accidental releases.  

A STORM WATER POLLUTION PREVENTION PLAN (SW3P) has also been fostered to illustrate best management practices, prevent releases, identify release potential, document past releases, monitor storm water for visual or analytical indications of impact, and to analyze the overall risk of accidental release of chemical.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY

NovaStar LP also maintains an E

MERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN (ERP) to affirm that emergency release scenarios of regulated substances are managed in a prompt and effective manner.  The NovaStar LP ERP details the general facility information, emergency contact numbers of local fire, police, and NovaStar LP officers, and Environmental Emergency Response contractors.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

NovaStar LP has no accident history to report.  The facility was constructed in 2005, and no regulated processes have been brought online to this date.  

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

NovaStar LP also maintains an EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN (EAP) to affirm that emergency release scenarios of regulated substances are managed in a prompt and effective manner.  The NovaStar LP ERP details the general facility information, emergency contact numbers of local fire, police, and NovaStar LP officers, and Environmental Emergency Response contractors.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

NovaStar LP plans to adjust accordingly to new process changes or hazards as they arise.  These new hazards will be identified through regular process hazard analysis and internal auditing.
